MAN.TITLE: LinePropertySpec
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: to customize the lines appearance in a plot (same effect than with LineSpec with more available options)

CALLING_SEQUENCE.CALLING_SEQUENCE_ITEM: None. The LinePropertySpec is an optional argument that can be used inside a plot command. It allows a global customization of all the new plotted lines. It has to be given as a couple {PropertyName, PropertyValue}. Several couples can be set at the same time in a plot call.

PropertyName must be a string defining the property to set.The PropertyValue can be a real, integer or string (scalar or matrix) depending on the type of property used. For example, to specify a red (color) longdash-dot (line style) with diamond marker (marker), the sequence should be : 'Colo','red','LineSt','-.','Marker','diam'.

As you can see, a full complete spelling of each property name and value is not required but those arguments, specified in any order, must remain unambiguous. Furthermore, the string specification is not case sensitive. LinePropertySpec is predominant on all LineSpec previously stated.

DESCRIPTION.P: Here is a complete list of the PropertyName you can specify (using plot) and their available associated PropertyValue.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Clipping:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a string "on" or "off" defining the clipping mode ("on" by default). It is equivalent to the clip_state propertyThis field contains the visible property (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Color or Foreground:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a string defining a known color (see color_list) or a 1x3 (or 3x1) RGB vector definig a color number. Color number is given as a 3-uple R, G, B corresponding respectively to red, green and blue intensity between 0 and 1. This property is linked to the object's foreground property (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: LineStyle:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This property value should be a string defining a line style. This property is linked to tje object's line_style property (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Marker or MarkStyle:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: A string defining the marker type. Note that if you specify a marker wihtout a line style, both line (with default solid mode enabled) and marker are drawn.This property is linked to the object's mark_style and mark_mode properties (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: MarkerEdgeColor or MarkForeground:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a string defining a known color (see color_list) or a 1x3 (or 3x1) RGB vector defining a color number. Color number is given as a 3-uple R, G, B corresponding respectively to red, green and blue intensity between 0 and 1. This property is linked to the object's mark_foreground property (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: MarkerFaceColor or MarkBackground:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a string defining a known color (see color_list) or a 1x3 (or 3x1) RGB vector defining a color number. Color number is given as a 3-uple R, G, B corresponding respectively to red, green and blue intensity between 0 and 1. This property is linked to the object's mark_background property (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: MarkerSize or MarkSize:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a scalar defining the marker size in point unit. This property is linked to the object's mark_size property with mark_size_unit enabled to "point" (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Visible:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a string "on" or "off" defining the visibility mode ("on" by default). This property is linked to the object's visible property (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: X data:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a real vector or matrix (re-)defining the given data for all the plotted lines. Conerning dimensions, note that this new data must match all the previous specified X data : that is to say all those data matrices must be of the same dimensions. This property is linked to the object's data property (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Y data:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a real vector or matrix (re-)defining the given data for all the plotted lines. Conerning dimensions, note that this new data must match all the previous specified Y data : that is to say all those data matrices must be of the same dimensions. This property is linked to the object's data property (see polyline_properties).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Z data:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a real vector or matrix adding a Z data for all the plotted lines. Concerning dimensions, note that this new data must match all the previous specified X and Y data. This property is linked to the object's data property (see polyline_properties).
